caption: Modern and unique outdoor art installation located in the Palais Royal in Paris. The black and white striped columns create a distinctive atmosphere, making it a great spot for photos or just a relaxing stroll. However, it can be a bit tricky to find the perfect spot for a photo because the area tends to be quite crowded. Despite that, the charm and creativity of the place make it worth a visit!
The contrast between modern intervention and ancient buildings makes for an enjoyable experience,  with plenty of photo opportunities.

I am not sure if the style and modernity of these colonnes really fit into this magnificent site. It is beautiful in itself, but I believe it would have been better  located near other modern sites like La Grande Arche in La Defense quarter or Le Centre Pompidou, probably not here.
Interesting black and white column installation. Good photo spot
Great photo spot with a beautiful garden for a picnic. We've been there several times. The entrance is slightly hidden.
One of the most unique parc in the heart of Paris. With the black and white multi size colonnes that is repetitious.

If this was anywhere accept Paris, I would agree it is a waste, of a perfectly good courtyard, however, in this city, it fits right in, and it is very popular with, tourists. We actually like how it fits in with the colonnades, of the Palais.

One of my favorite spots to enjoy some interesting art installation and see how many tourists had their fun here. It's quite a contrasting view surrounded with historical building. Suggest to come earlier to skip the crowd.

While you're in Paris, don't miss this beautiful art installation by Daniel Buren.  Located in the courtyard of the Palais Royal, the art installation is stunning to see in person and is wonderful for those who enjoy photography. Take a few moments to stop in, as I'm sure you won't be disappointed.

Nice place to visit. It was fun photoshoot for out baby. It is open to all public all the time. You can also rest in neraby garden. It is very close to Louvre museam. Often shadowed by charm of Louvre, but according to me, it is must see place.

Amazing modern sculptures! Great place to have fun and take photos, also see people struggle to climb the tall sculptures üòÅ It's open 24*7 and can get really crowded. Located next to a beautiful garden and can be found near the Louvre Museum. ‚Ä¶

The Daniel Buren's art installation is part of spectacular Palais-Royal and Palais-Royal gardens. It's a nice place to hang out. While the square is open 24/7 I would recommend going early. It is a very popular place for people taking pictures.
What a delight. This is such a fun space with kids and adults both enjoying the sculptures. I‚Äôd recommend swinging by if you‚Äôre nearby. The buildings surrounding are beautiful too.
A wonderful photo op in Paris that is rarely crowded. Steps away from the louvre, you must visit. Not as popular as the main attractions but that‚Äôs what makes it a pleasure to visit.

In 1986, the Ministry of Culture commissioned the sculptor Daniel Buren with their creation to adorn the Cour d‚ÄôHonneur of the Palais-Royal. The 260 columns are made of white Carrara marble from Italy and black marble from the French Pyr√©n√©es. All columns take root in the basement and emerge outdoor in different heights, creating a particular rhythm, and giving an unusual contrast with the classical architecture of the surrounding Palace.  During the Colonnes‚Äô design and installation, intense debates ensued about the suitability of integrating contemporary art with historic landmarks. It was called a ‚Äúrude gesture,‚Äù an ‚Äúintellectual absurdity,‚Äù a classless ‚Äúchessboard‚Äù and ‚Äúlicorice sticks.‚Äù The debate was similar to those over the Louvre‚Äôs I.M. Pei Pyramid, the Centre Pompidou, and myriad other sites.  Petitions were launched to attempt to halt or destroy the installation. Graffiti desecrated the site. Left and right wing factions battled. Mitterand demanded that the project proceed as planned. In the end, he won and the art work was installed.
For many a hidden place right next to Louvre and a perfect place to make a stop to enjoy before or after your visit on the Louvre.

The Colonnes de Buren are such a lovely exhibit to visit.  Also a really fun place to take photos and interact with the art.  There was no way we were getting photos without people in them, unless coming super early - but it wasn't too busy in the late afternoon when we stopped in to play around on the black and white stumps.

This place is perfect for photos and people watching! It's always a treat to watch people struggle to get on top of the taller sculptures. Sometimes you can even watch people fish spare change from the gutters using magnets. Grab a to go coffee from the nearby Starbucks and a book- and you could happily spend an hour here relaxing.
I visited this place just after the confinement, so I found it peaceful, the perfect place to drink a coffee and enjoy the amazing architecture. The garden is very pretty

Monochrome dream! This work of art by Buren uses the finest Carrara marble to create a checkerboard pattern in the Palais Royale. Arresting to the eyes and a beautiful marriage of modern sculpture and ancient architecture. Visually arresting and peaceful all at the same time!
Very cozy nice yard with interesting architecture.
Beautiful place, unique experience.  instagram worthy pics everywhere
Neat area. Fun spot for pictures.
Worth visiting! Especially during the early hours of the day.

Of the top locations to get those classical Paris pictures.  Can be very busy and is also located in one of the most touristy areas in Paris.  Best to come early morning or late evening to avoid crowds if you want less people in your pictures or watching you!
Beautiful place and fun to climb the poles! A lovely garden too.
The location is great, the garden next to this place is beautiful. However, the sculptures are of a very poor taste and don't fit the atmosphere of that beautiful building surrounding it
At first I thought that it isn‚Äôt going to be something special, but it‚Äôs different when u see it in person. It was really unique and u could get some cool photos for instagram etc.

A lovely place for some fun pictures!  It's right next to the Louvre so a very easy stop by to get a nice picture.  There are a lot of people taking pictures, but everyone takes turns and it's easy to get a good shot.  Very pretty installation!
Veru quite place, great for the rest stop for tourists.
Open space to chill in heart of Paris. Always something going on.
Nice outdoor art to hangout
Paris exists to remind all your dreams are real
Enjoying this wonderful place during lockdown üòªüòª ‚Ä¶
Nice enough courtyard, but packed with tourists.

We stumbled upon this place on our way back to our hotel, I have to say, it was really quite cool. These random, columns of varying height looked fun for everyone. The tall ones for the children to climb on, and the shorter ones for the adults to sit and rest! Would recommend this place; it is quite peculiar! :)
Different places to take funny photos!! ‚ú®

Came to see Daniel Buren's art installation and wasn't disappointed. While the square is open 24/7 I would recommend going early in the day or later in the evening so there are less people around when taking a picture.
